overview: The purpose of this measure is to establish an adjudication system and procedures to process fireworks infractions. [6] The bill is intended to facilitate more effective enforcement of Hawaii’s fireworks control laws by amending definitions, strengthening criminal offenses, establishing new offenses, and creating heightened penalties for repeat offenders or when offenses result in injury or death. [5] [5] This measure also establishes various criminal offenses and penalties related to fireworks or articles pyrotechnics and appropriates funds to the Judiciary to implement the bill. [6]

assumptions_and_methodology: For many years, Hawaii’s state laws regarding illicit fireworks have made it difficult for state and county agencies to enforce or prosecute these types of cases. [5] Prosecutors have repeatedly cited challenges posed by "gathering evidence and meeting the high burden of proof necessary for convictions", as well as "stringent definitions [in statute, that] . . . routinely create roadblocks to effective prosecution." [5] This bill would largely address the concerns raised by prosecutors, and provide greater clarity and efficiency for law enforcement, prosecutors, and the courts that handle these cases. [5]
agency_impact: This bill is expected to provide greater clarity and efficiency for law enforcement, prosecutors, and the courts that handle fireworks cases. [5] The establishment of various criminal offenses and penalties related to fireworks and articles pyrotechnics will provide law enforcement with additional tools to combat illegal fireworks activities. [5] The Department of the Attorney General recommends amending the definition of "inspector" and noted it is unclear which law enforcement officers may be designated as administrative inspectors. economic_impact: Better enforcement of the fireworks control laws is essential not only to safeguard property from preventable fire damage but also to protect the community from injuries related to fires and explosions. [5] Enforcement can also protect from respiratory issues caused by air pollution, and ongoing trauma experienced by individuals due to loud explosions. [5] [5] Despite tragic deaths and injuries spanning many years, the crime of using illegal fireworks is rarely punished. [5]
